其他释义

entry.def: A family is a group of people who are related to each other, especially parents and their children.

example.ex: There's room in there for a family of five...
His family are completely behind him, whatever he decides...
example.tran: 他无论作出什么决定，家人都全力支持。

entry.def: When people talk about a family, they sometimes mean children.

example.ex: They decided to start a family.

entry.def: When people talk about their family, they sometimes mean their ancestors.

example.ex: Her family came to Los Angeles at the turn of the century.
example.tran: 她的祖先在世纪之交时来到洛杉矶。

example.ex: ...homes where their families had lived for generations.

entry.def: You can use family to describe things that belong to a particular family.

example.ex: He returned to the family home...
I was working in the family business.

entry.def: You can use family to describe things that are designed to be used or enjoyed by both parents and children.
entry.tran: 全家共用的;全家共享的

example.ex: It had been designed as a family house...
example.tran: 这房子的设计适合一家老小共同居住。

example.ex: A wedding is a family event.

entry.def: A family of animals or plants is a group of related species.

example.ex: ...foods in the cabbage family, such as Brussels sprouts.
example.tran: 抱子甘蓝之类的十字花科食物

means.word_mean: 1. a social unit living together;

sentences.sentence: "I waited until the whole house was asleep"
"the teacher asked how many people made up his home"

means.word_mean: 2. primary social group; parents and children;

sentences.sentence: "he wanted to have a good job before starting a family"

means.word_mean: 3. people descended from a common ancestor;

sentences.sentence: "his family has lived in Massachusetts since the Mayflower"

means.word_mean: 4. a collection of things sharing a common attribute;
5. an association of people who share common beliefs or activities;

sentences.sentence: "the message was addressed not just to employees but to every member of the company family"
"the church welcomed new members into its fellowship"

means.word_mean: 6. (biology) a taxonomic group containing one or more genera;
7. a person having kinship with another or others;
8. a loose affiliation of gangsters in charge of organized criminal activities
